item.title:

item.description:
The 80/20 rule is DESTROYING solo developers:
â†’ AI gets you 80% in 2 days â†’ You think you're winning â†’ The final 20% takes 6 months â†’ You abandon ship for the next shiny object
I'm deep in this cycle with my voice app.
Building marketing tools to market the main product.
Classic rabbit hole behavior.
STAY FOCUSED

item.title: Indie SaaS rarely dies from 'no features.' It dies from slow feedback. Tighten the loop: pick 1 metric per feature, ship every day, delete what doesnâ€™t move it. You donâ€™t need more ideasâ€”you need fast
item.description: Indie SaaS rarely dies from 'no features.' It dies from slow feedback. Tighten the loop: pick 1 metric per feature, ship every day, delete what doesnâ€™t move it. You donâ€™t need more ideasâ€”you need faster iteration and ruthless scope.

item.title: Most teams overcomplicate ad creative testing. Ours auto-generates static variants by combining your product images + brand assets, pulls proven copy angles from your ad account, and ships ready-to-ru
item.description: Most teams overcomplicate ad creative testing. Ours auto-generates static variants by combining your product images + brand assets, pulls proven copy angles from your ad account, and ships ready-to-run creatives in minutes. Less guessing, faster learnings.

item.title: Building a Gemini-powered creative generator. It pulls your winning ad angles, product images, and brand kit to output on-brand static variants in minutes. Aim: 20 testable creatives without waiting o
item.description: Building a Gemini-powered creative generator. It pulls your winning ad angles, product images, and brand kit to output on-brand static variants in minutes. Aim: 20 testable creatives without waiting on design. Want early access? Reply 'beta'.

item.title: If your AI app needs a tutorial, your UX is the bug. I'm building with Gemini and the bar is simple: first run delivers an "oh wow" in under 60s, zero docs. Every extra toggle = one more user lost. Re
item.description: If your AI app needs a tutorial, your UX is the bug. I'm building with Gemini and the bar is simple: first run delivers an "oh wow" in under 60s, zero docs. Every extra toggle = one more user lost. Remove steps until it feels inevitable.

item.title: I built a creative engine that pairs Gemini with your ad data. It pulls top-performing angles, blends them with your product images + brand kit, chooses typography, and outputs fresh static variants i
item.description: I built a creative engine that pairs Gemini with your ad data. It pulls top-performing angles, blends them with your product images + brand kit, chooses typography, and outputs fresh static variants in minutes. Faster tests, tighter feedback loops, cheaper wins.

item.title: Static ads still print if your creative velocity is high. I built a Gemini workflow that pulls your topâ€‘performing ad data, blends it with product images + brand kit, and generates onâ€‘brand variants f
item.description: Static ads still print if your creative velocity is high. I built a Gemini workflow that pulls your topâ€‘performing ad data, blends it with product images + brand kit, and generates onâ€‘brand variants fast. Pick a font, review, ship. More shots on goal, lower CPA.

item.title: Static ads don't need 'inspiration', they need inputs. Pipe product images + brand kit + winning creative data into Gemini, lock type + layout, then spin 20 variants. Score by CTR/CVR, ship the top 2,
item.description: Static ads don't need 'inspiration', they need inputs. Pipe product images + brand kit + winning creative data into Gemini, lock type + layout, then spin 20 variants. Score by CTR/CVR, ship the top 2, archive the rest. Creativity at the speed of ops.

item.description: Gemini-powered creative engine: pull a brandâ€™s assets via API (think Lululemon), fuse old + new, auto-generate an infinite scroll of on-brand product shots for Meta. Not replacing designersâ€”weaponizing what already converts.

item.description: Brands donâ€™t need more shoots. They need multiplication. â†’ Pull approved assets via API (e.g., Lululemon) â†’ Gemini combines old + new to fill missing angles/variations â†’ Scrollable mosaic = instant Meta ad creatives Fewer shoots. Faster iteration. Lower CAC.

item.description: The fix for ad creative fatigue: pull proven brand assets via API, let Gemini recombine, and ship a scrolling mosaic of on-brand product shots for instant testing. Faster cycles, consistent look, lower CAC.

item.description: Built an ads generator that remixes what already converts: pull top Meta creatives from your niche (think Lululemonâ€™s best), blend with your product shots + brand assets, run through Gemini Flash. Result: 30â€“100 fresh variants in minutes, not weeks.

item.title: Most teams waste time ideating ads from scratch. We scrape your category's winners, pair with your product shots, and let Gemini Flash remix 100 variants in minutes. Result: faster tests, lower CAC. C
item.description: Most teams waste time ideating ads from scratch. We scrape your category's winners, pair with your product shots, and let Gemini Flash remix 100 variants in minutes. Result: faster tests, lower CAC. Creative ops is a data problem, not a design problem.
